name: Creamy Vegan Carbonara
description: This Creamy Vegan Carbonara is downright irresistible and easy to make. A creamy sauce coats the pasta and the tofu "pancetta" is pure heaven. Top with fresh basil and vegan parmesan for a truly incredible meal!
recipeIngredient: 14 ounce block firm or extra-firm tofu, pressed
1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce/ tamari for gluten free
1 tablespoon  liquid smoke/ or use 2 teaspoons smoked paprika instead
12 ounces spaghetti noodles (I used gluten free brown rice noodles)
Optional:  Vegan Parmesan (*I used Violife parmesan )

itemListElement.text: Press the tofu: Drain the tofu and wrap it in a clean tea towel. Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books or a cast iron pan on top of that. Let the tofu press for at least 30 minutes if possible.
itemListElement.name: Press the tofu: Drain the tofu and wrap it in a clean tea towel. Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books or a cast iron pan on top of that. Let the tofu press for at least 30 minutes if possible.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

itemListElement.text: Cut the tofu into small cubes. In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, tomato paste, olive oil, garlic powder and liquid smoke. Add the tofu pieces and stir well to coat in the sauce.
itemListElement.name: Cut the tofu into small cubes. In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, tomato paste, olive oil, garlic powder and liquid smoke. Add the tofu pieces and stir well to coat in the sauce.

itemListElement.text: Dump the tofu/sauce mixture onto the prepared pan and spread the tofu out evenly. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes, flipping the tofu over once halfway through cooking. Be careful not to burn the tofu. Remove and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Dump the tofu/sauce mixture onto the prepared pan and spread the tofu out evenly. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes, flipping the tofu over once halfway through cooking. Be careful not to burn the tofu. Remove and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Pour the hot water over the cashews and let soak for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Pour the hot water over the cashews and let soak for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Drain the cashews and discard the soaking water. Add them to a blender along with the garlic, 2 cups fresh water, nutritional yeast, lemon juice and salt. Blend until very smooth. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Drain the cashews and discard the soaking water. Add them to a blender along with the garlic, 2 cups fresh water, nutritional yeast, lemon juice and salt. Blend until very smooth. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Boil the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and return back to the pot. Add in the cream sauce and stir over low-medium heat until the sauce thickens somewhat.
itemListElement.name: Boil the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and return back to the pot. Add in the cream sauce and stir over low-medium heat until the sauce thickens somewhat.

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately with tofu "pancetta", fresh basil and vegan parmesan, as desired. Enjoy!
